citations.narrative:
The facility does not have perimeter fences around two new nonhuman primate enclosures. The licensee recently
acquired a young, brown capuchin which is being housed in an enclosure without a perimeter fence. In another area of
the facility, a new enclosure was created for the two gibbons, but it is not enclosed by a perimeter fence.
A perimeter fence is important to ensure that the nonhuman primates are protected from unauthorized humans and
animals which may intend to have contact with them.
Licensees are required to enclose outdoor housing facilities with a perimeter fence, not less than 6 feet high and not less
than 3 feet in distance from the primary enclosure. The fence must be constructed so that it protects the nonhuman
primates by restricting unauthorized humans and animals, and must be of sufficient distance from the primary enclosure
to prevent physical contact between animals inside the enclosure and animals outside the perimeter fence.
Correct by: December 31, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.78(d) 
   
Outdoor housing facilities. 
The facility does not have perimeter fences around two new nonhuman primate enclosures. The licensee recently 
acquired a young, brown capuchin which is being housed in an enclosure without a perimeter fence. In another area of 
the facility, a new enclosure was created for the two gibbons, but it is not enclosed by a perimeter fence.  
A perimeter fence is important to ensure that the nonhuman primates are protected from unauthorized humans and 
animals which may intend to have contact with them.  
Licensees are required to enclose outdoor housing facilities with a perimeter fence, not less than 6 feet high and not less 
than 3 feet in distance from the primary enclosure. The fence must be constructed so that it protects the nonhuman 
primates by restricting unauthorized humans and animals, and must be of sufficient distance from the primary enclosure 
to prevent physical contact between animals inside the enclosure and animals outside the perimeter fence.  
Correct by: December 31, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
